conclusion: The object experiences kinetic friction as it slides on the conveyor belt.
Calculate the frictional force using f = μmg with μ = 0.3, m = 3 kg, and g = 10 m/s², resulting in f = 9 N.
Determine the acceleration of the object using a = f/m, resulting in a = 3 m/s².
The object accelerates until it reaches the belt's speed v = 6 m/s.
Use the kinematic equation v² = u² + 2aL' with u = 0 and v = 6 m/s to solve for L', resulting in L' = 6 m.
Calculate the work done by friction using W = f × L', resulting in W = 54 J.
The frictional force does work on the object over the distance L' = 6 m, resulting in 54 J of work done.
